org.company

Class TestExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.company.TestExecutor

  • public class TestExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the methods for running test cases on a use case. The class also collects relevant execution metrics (time, coverage, memory)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String pathOfJaCoCoAgent
      The path of the JaCoCo agent jar for executing tests with coverage
      private java.lang.String pathOfJarContainingTests
      The path of the jar containing the test cases for the code to execute
      private java.lang.String pathOfJarToExecute
      The path of the jar containing the code to protect execute
      private java.lang.String pathOfJUnitConsoleJar
      The path of the JUnit Console jar
      private boolean withCoverage
      Flag for stating whether the tests should be executed with coverage or not

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestExecutor(@NotNull java.lang.String pathOfJarToExecute, @NotNull java.lang.String pathOfJarContainingTests, @NotNull java.lang.String pathOfJUnitConsoleJar)
      The constructor accepts as arguments the path of the jar to execute and the path of the jar containing test files

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TestExecutor runTests(@NotNull java.io.File directoryWhereToSaveFiles)
      This function launches the tests on the code, eventually collecting execution metrics Remember that the execution time given by JUnit is not precise if tests are run with JaCoCo The function saves output files in the given folder.
      TestExecutor withCoverage(java.lang.String pathOfJaCoCoAgent)
      If invoked, the test executor will run tests with coverage (i.e., with JaCoCo).

    • Constructor Detail

      • TestExecutor

        public TestExecutor(@NotNull java.lang.String pathOfJarToExecute,
                    @NotNull java.lang.String pathOfJarContainingTests,
                    @NotNull java.lang.String pathOfJUnitConsoleJar)
        The constructor accepts as arguments the path of the jar to execute and the path of the jar containing test files
        Parameters:
        pathOfJarToExecute - Absolute path of the jar containing the code to protect execute
        pathOfJarContainingTests - Absolute path of the jar containing the test cases for the code to execute
        pathOfJUnitConsoleJar - Absolute path of the JUnit console jar to actually run the tests

    • Method Detail

      • withCoverage

        public TestExecutor withCoverage(java.lang.String pathOfJaCoCoAgent)
        If invoked, the test executor will run tests with coverage (i.e., with JaCoCo). Remember that the execution time given by JUnit is not precise if tests are run with coverage. The execution of the tests will produce two files, jacoco.exec and jacoco.xml, containing the results of the methods coverage
        Parameters:
        pathOfJaCoCoAgent - Absolute path of the JaCoCo agent jar for executing tests with coverage
        Returns:
        this instance of TestExecutor

      • runTests

        public TestExecutor runTests(@NotNull java.io.File directoryWhereToSaveFiles)
        This function launches the tests on the code, eventually collecting execution metrics Remember that the execution time given by JUnit is not precise if tests are run with JaCoCo The function saves output files in the given folder. In detail, output files are - "junitOutput.txt": the output of the JUnit console jar - (if run with coverage): "jacoco.exec", "jacoco.xml": contains methods coverage by JaCoCo - (if run without coverage): "TEST-junit-jupiter.xml": contains JUnit report and execution time
        Parameters:
        directoryWhereToSaveFiles - directory where to save output files (JUnit and JaCoCO reports)
        Returns:
        this instance of TestExecutor
